snippet: A storm packing winds of more than 100 miles per hour appeared to be headed directly for Tokyo.
lead_paragraph: A storm packing winds of more than 100 miles per hour appeared to be headed directly for Tokyo.
abstract: Air Force says an American airman was killed and two others are missing after they were swept out to sea by powerful typhoon that struck Okinawa, Japan.

headline.main: Typhoon Sweeps 3 Americans Out to Sea in Okinawa
headline.print_headline: Typhoon Sweeps 3 Americans Out to Sea in Okinawa

snippet: Create a rapid blood-testing system for travelers from affected regions.
lead_paragraph: Create a rapid blood-testing system for travelers from affected regions.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Siddhartha Mukherjee contends Ebola case of Thomas Eric Duncan in Dallas shows that medical community must rethink concept of quarantine, in light of the absence of any established anti-viral treatment; calls for development of pilot program for rapid-testing quarantine.

headline.main: How to Quarantine Against Ebola
headline.print_headline: How to Quarantine Against Ebola

snippet: More than 12 years after the Bush administration first sent detainees to the prison in Cuba, tensions are mounting over whether President Obama can close it before leaving office.
lead_paragraph: More than 12 years after the Bush administration first sent detainees to the prison in Cuba, tensions are mounting over whether President Obama can close it before leaving office.
abstract: Tensions are mounting over whether Pres Obama can keep campaign pledge to close military prison at Guantanamo Bay Naval Base in Cuba, even as structure decays and inmates age; government is bracing for a wave of new habeas corpus lawsuits after American combat operations in Afghanistan come to an end in December, raising issue of whether legal basis for wartime detentions at Guantanamo Bay has expired.

headline.main: Decaying Guantánamo Defies Closing Plans
headline.print_headline: Decaying Guantánamo Defies Closing Plans

snippet: Before the opening of the United Nations General Assembly, negotiators have discussed a plan to remove the pipes that connect Iran’s nuclear centrifuges.
lead_paragraph: Before the opening of the United Nations General Assembly, negotiators have discussed a plan to remove the pipes that connect Iran’s nuclear centrifuges.
abstract: American negotiators are attempting new approach to slowing Iran's production of nuclear fuel, suggesting that Iranians take away many of the pipes that connect their nuclear centrifuges; approach gives Iranians a way to save face and is one of a few ideas that may offer glimmer of hope in closed-door negotiations before Pres Obama and Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani arrive in New York for annual opening of United Nations.

headline.main: U.S. Hopes Face-Saving Plan Offers a Path to a Nuclear Pact With Iran
headline.print_headline: U.S. Hopes Face-Saving Plan Offers a Path to a Nuclear Pact With Iran

snippet: Who’s to blame for the recent major lapses from the Secret Service?
lead_paragraph: Who’s to blame for the recent major lapses from the Secret Service?
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column blames lapses in Secret Service protection of Pres Obama in part on political class more concerned with reelection than with running country; holds that government selfishness and inattention, while not wholly responsible for Secret Service lapses, affects every federal department in terms of morale, motivation and oversight; says those working for government no longer take pride in their work or expect great things from America.

headline.seo: The Secret Service and the Political Class
headline.main: Running on Empty
headline.print_headline: Running On Empty

lead_paragraph: The president spoke at the United Nations Climate Change Summit on Tuesday.

headline.main: Obama on Climate Change

headline.main: Is Job Training Doing What It’s Supposed to Do?
headline.print_headline: Is Job Training Doing What It’s Supposed to Do?

snippet: Klay Thompson scored 20 points and James Harden had 12 of his 14 in the third quarter after a scoreless first half, helping the United States national team turn a close game into a 119-76 rout of Slovenia.
lead_paragraph: Klay Thompson scored 20 points and James Harden had 12 of his 14 in the third quarter after a scoreless first half, helping the United States national team turn a close game into a 119-76 rout of Slovenia.
abstract: United States routs Slovenia, 119-76; other basketball news noted.

headline.main: United States Routs Slovenia to Advance
headline.print_headline: United States Routs Slovenia to Advance

snippet: Debt scolds hate good fiscal news so much that most Americans haven’t heard that the deficit plunge of the past several years continues.
lead_paragraph: Debt scolds hate good fiscal news so much that most Americans haven’t heard that the deficit plunge of the past several years continues.
abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column examines why there has been so little fanfare surrounding fact that deficit has fallen significantly and continues to fall; blames news media coverage of deficit, which plays up bad news and downplays good news, if it is reported at all; criticizes deficit scolds, who in fact love big budget deficits because fears of fiscal crisis are their best hope of getting big cuts in social programs, which is their ultimate goal.

headline.main: Secret Deficit Lovers
headline.print_headline: Secret Deficit Lovers

snippet: The number of Cubans attempting the voyage to the United States has nearly doubled in the past two years, putting the spotlight on the growing frustration with a post-Fidel Cuba.
lead_paragraph: The number of Cubans attempting the voyage to the United States has nearly doubled in the past two years, putting the spotlight on the growing frustration with a post-Fidel Cuba.
abstract: Rising tide of Cubans in rickety, cobbled-together boats is fleeing the island and showing up in the waters of Florida; not since rafter crisis of 1994 has United States received so many Cuban migrants; increase highlights consequences of a US immigration policy that gives preferential treatment to Cubans and on loosened travel restrictions on island, and it shines light on growing frustration of a post-Fidel Castro Cuba.

headline.main: In Rickety Boats, Cuban Migrants Again Flee to U.S.
headline.print_headline: In Rickety Boats, Cuban Migrants Again Flee to U.S.

snippet: Voters appear ready to say to Congress, we hate you for your inaction. Now do more of the same.
lead_paragraph: Voters appear ready to say to Congress, we hate you for your inaction. Now do more of the same.
abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column questions why American voters, majority of whom oppose what Republican Party stands for, appear ready to give them control of Senate and greater hold on House in elections; lists number of risks that greater Republican control of Congress poses and urges voters to consider exactly what Republicans believe; accuses GOP of petty partisanship and, in some cases, crazy thinking.

headline.main: Why Do We Re-elect Them?
headline.print_headline: Why Do We Re-elect Them?

abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Robert N Stavins expresses pessimism at prospect of intensive global effort to combat climate change in light of real-world economic and political realities; notes that developing convergence of interests between China and United States offers hope for progress.

snippet: Democratic candidates — even those in states like Virginia that the president carried in 2008 and 2012 — do not want President Obama to campaign for them.
lead_paragraph: Democratic candidates — even those in states like Virginia that the president carried in 2008 and 2012 — do not want President Obama to campaign for them.
abstract: Pres Obama has become isolated political figures who is viewed as liability to Democrats running for office in state where voters by the thousands once cheered for him; some leading Democrats say it would be better for Obama to make case for party's economic policies safely away from the most crucial races.

headline.main: In This Election, Obama’s Party Benches Him
headline.print_headline: In This Election, Obama’s Party Benches Him

snippet: The United States Chamber of Commerce, in a report on Beijing’s aggressive enforcement of its antimonopoly law, raises the prospect of a formal trade complaint.
lead_paragraph: The United States Chamber of Commerce, in a report on Beijing’s aggressive enforcement of its antimonopoly law, raises the prospect of a formal trade complaint.
abstract: United States Chamber of Commerce, in a report on China's aggressive enforcement of its antimonopoly law, raises the prospect of a formal trade complaint with World Trade Organization.

headline.main: China’s Antitrust Campaign Seen as Possible Breach of W.T.O. Rules
headline.print_headline: China’s Antitrust Campaign Seen as Possible Breach of W.T.O. Rules

snippet: It’s time for some major-league soul-searching as we look at the candidates running in the midterm elections.
lead_paragraph: It’s time for some major-league soul-searching as we look at the candidates running in the midterm elections.
abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column offers guide to bad and incompetent behaviors shared by Congressional candidates and weighs how such factors should affect one's vote.

headline.main: Rules to Vote By
headline.print_headline: Rules To Vote By

snippet: Remember all the talk about how Citizens United would give Republicans a spending advantage forevermore? That hasn’t happened.
lead_paragraph: Remember all the talk about how Citizens United would give Republicans a spending advantage forevermore? That hasn’t happened.
abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column assesses how the Supreme Court's Citizens United decision has affected campaign finance; questions whether Democrats, who have loudly denounced decision, have benefited more from it than Republicans; contends decision ultimately reduces influence of money on electoral outcomes.

headline.main: Money Matters Less
headline.print_headline: Money Matters Less

snippet: Both the Republican and Democratic governors’ associations have set up social welfare groups with the purpose of raising secret political money.
lead_paragraph: Both the Republican and Democratic governors’ associations have set up social welfare groups with the purpose of raising secret political money.
abstract: Editorial highlights accidental Internet disclosure in September showing influx of corporate money into governors' offices around country via social welfare groups with purpose of raising secret political money; contends that there is no legal justification for any political party to have social welfare group; warns that whether money is secret or disclosed, both Democrats and Republicans are routinely selling access to nations governors and their staffs to those with most resources.

headline.main: Secretly Buying Access to a Governor
headline.print_headline: Secretly Buying Access to a Governor

abstract: A study of Facebook use suggests we may become less self-obsessed as we age.

snippet: With four weeks to go before the midterm elections, Republicans are pointing to the Islamic State, Secret Service failings and Ebola as evidence of what they call White House incompetence.
lead_paragraph: With four weeks to go before the midterm elections, Republicans are pointing to the Islamic State, Secret Service failings and Ebola as evidence of what they call White House incompetence.
abstract: Political Memo: Republican strategy in final weeks leading up to midterm elections seems to be pointing to Islamic State, Secret Service failings and Ebola as proof of Obama administration incompetence; their decidedly grim message is that Pres Obama and Democrats cannot keep Americans safe from harm.

headline.main: Cry of G.O.P. in Campaign: All Is Dismal
headline.print_headline: Cry of G.O.P. in Campaign: All Is Dismal

snippet: Progressive spending, not taxes, is the key to reducing inequality.
lead_paragraph: Progressive spending, not taxes, is the key to reducing inequality.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Edward D Kleinbard contends addressing income inequality in America through tax structure is wrong way to think about the issue; calls for a progressive fiscal system, which would encompass both the tax and spending sides of government.

headline.main: Don’t Soak the Rich
headline.print_headline: Don’t Soak the Rich

snippet: A deputy prime minister publicly blamed the agency for creating the extremist group, and interviews suggested that most of the few thousand people at a demonstration Saturday subscribed to the same theory.
lead_paragraph: A deputy prime minister publicly blamed the agency for creating the extremist group, and interviews suggested that most of the few thousand people at a demonstration Saturday subscribed to the same theory.
abstract: People of Baghdad welcome American airstrikes against extremists of the Islamic State, but many Iraqis still believe ISIS and the Central Intelligence Agency are united.

headline.main: Suspicions Run Deep in Iraq That C.I.A. and the Islamic State Are United
headline.print_headline: Suspicions Run Deep in Iraq That C.I.A. and the Islamic State Are United

snippet: The website for the Pentagon’s Vietnam War anniversary commemoration largely describes a war of valor and honor that would be unrecognizable to many of the Americans who fought in and against it.
lead_paragraph: The website for the Pentagon’s Vietnam War anniversary commemoration largely describes a war of valor and honor that would be unrecognizable to many of the Americans who fought in and against it.
abstract: Pentagon is planning 50th anniversary commemoration of the Vietnam War; effort, which is expected to cost taxpayers nearly $15 million by the end of 2014 fiscal year, is intended to honor veterans; leading Vietnam historians complain, however, that website focuses on dozens of medal-winning soldiers while giving scant mention to mistakes by generals and years of violent protests and anguished debate at home.

headline.main: Paying Respects, Pentagon Revives Vietnam, and War Over Truth
headline.print_headline: Paying Respects, Pentagon Revives Vietnam, and War Over Truth

snippet: Passing a stopgap spending bill and keeping the Export-Import Bank open are among the modest objectives that lawmakers have set this month.
lead_paragraph: Passing a stopgap spending bill and keeping the Export-Import Bank open are among the modest objectives that lawmakers have set this month.
abstract: Members of Congress return to Capitol with as few as seven legislative days remaining before they return home for November midterm elections; legislators have set modest goals for their return, in keeping with brief time period.

headline.main: Light Pre-Election Schedule in Congress Matches Legislative Goals
headline.print_headline: Light Pre-Election Schedule in Congress Matches Legislative Goals
